document_title: Acute prostatitis: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
The most common cause of acute prostatitis is bacteria.(2) Specifically, these include:
Bacteria that cause UTIs that can cause prostatitis include: Proteus, Klebsiella, Escherichia coli.; Some bacteria cause gonorrhea and Chlamydia.
In addition, a number of other common medical conditions can also lead to this serious condition, including:
Urethritis.; Epididymitis.; Phimosis.; Perineal trauma.; Bladder outlet obstruction (may occur due to an enlarged prostate or stones in the bladder).; Damage caused by using a urinary catheter or cystoscopy.
subsection_title: viem tuyen tien liet cap tinh.json. What causes acute prostatitis?
